main event: A witness observed a bright, round light in the sky to the west of Cleveland, Ohio, at approximately 10:55 p.m. EST on April 20, 1961.
interesting points: The light remained stationary for a few seconds before disappearing instantly., The sighting lasted about 5-10 seconds., The Air Force concluded the incident was likely due to aircraft or astronomical phenomena., The observer described the light as very bright and round., There was known aircraft activity in the area at the time of the sighting.
witness description: Caucasian adult male, age 30, residing in Bedford Heights, Ohio.
